content: The "Lawsuit Abuse Reduction Act of 2004" may be cited as the short title. Attorney accountability is addressed in the Act. Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure is amended to impose sanctions on attorneys, law firms, or parties for signing pleadings, motions, or papers in violation of the rule. Sanctions may include ordering the other party to pay for expenses incurred, including attorney's fees. Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure is amended to impose sanctions on attorneys, law firms, or parties for signing pleadings, motions, or papers in violation of the rule. Sanctions may include ordering the other party to pay for expenses incurred, including attorney's fees. The amendments specify that the court shall award attorney's fees and sanctions should be sufficient to deter repetition of such conduct and compensate injured parties. The amendment to Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure imposes sanctions for violations, including ordering payment of expenses and attorney's fees. In State court civil actions affecting interstate commerce, the court must determine within 30 days if the action impacts the interstate economy. If so, Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure applies. This aims to prevent forum-shopping. A personal injury claim must be filed in the State and county where the person bringing the claim resides, where the injury occurred, or where the defendant's principal place of business is located. If the injury occurred in multiple locations, the trial court will determine the most appropriate forum. The court determines the most appropriate forum for a personal injury claim. If another forum is deemed more suitable, the claim is dismissed. The statute of limitations is tolled from the filing date until dismissal. The term "person" includes any individual or entity, excluding governmental entities. The term "State" encompasses various territories. This section applies to personal injury claims. This section applies to any personal injury claim filed in Federal or State court on or after the date of the enactment of this Act in the United States. SEC. 5. RULE OF CONSTRUCTION. This section does not prevent the assertion of new claims under civil rights laws. SEC. 6. THREE-STRIKES RULE FOR SUSPENDING ATTORNEYS WHO COMMIT MULTIPLE RULE 11 VIOLATIONS. Whenever a Federal district court finds an attorney violating Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure three or more times, the court must suspend the attorney from practicing law in that district for one year, with the option of additional suspension. The attorney can appeal the suspension, which will be stayed during the appeal process. Reinstatement to practice law in the district is possible after completing the suspension. To be reinstated to practice law in a Federal district court after a suspension, the attorney must petition the court for reinstatement under prescribed procedures and conditions. Enhanced sanctions for document destruction in court proceedings include civil penalties for willful destruction of relevant documents, applicable in both Federal and State courts.
